iti100:0.3: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
iti100:0.4: The Holy Offering of the Teaching
iti100:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti100:2.1: “I, Mendicants, am a brahmin, committed to charity, always open-handed, bearing my final body, a healer, a surgeon.
iti100:2.2: You are my rightful children, born of my mouth, born of the teaching, created by the teaching, heirs in the teaching, not in material things.
iti100:3.2: A gift of material things and a gift of the teaching.
iti100:3.3: The better of these two gifts is the gift of the teaching.
iti100:4.1: There are these two kinds of sharing.
iti100:4.2: Sharing material things and sharing the teaching.
iti100:4.3: The better of these two kinds of sharing is sharing the teaching.
iti100:5.1: There are these two kinds of support.
iti100:5.2: Support in material things and support in the teaching.
iti100:5.3: The better of these two kinds of support is support in the teaching.
iti100:6.2: An offering of material things and an offering of the teaching.
iti100:6.3: The better of these two offerings is an offering of the teaching.”
iti100:6.4: That is what the Buddha said.
iti100:7.1: “The Realized One, compassionate for all living creatures,
iti100:7.3: Sentient beings revere him, first among gods and humans,
iti100:8.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
